metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13668 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in developer tools in Google Chrome priorto 77.0.3865.75 allowed a remote attacker to leak cross-origin data via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13668` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 77.0.3865.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 77.0.3865.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 77.0.3865.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 77.0.3865.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 77.0.3865.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '77.0.3865.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
